msItem.note: Fols. i–iii are paper flyleaves, blank apart from modern notes.

msItem.title: Matthew–1 Timothy 2:12 in the Earlier Version of the Wycliffite Bible
msItem.note: Ending at but for to be in scilence forsoþe…; usual prologues. Rubrics in red, e.g., Here bigynnythe the prologe of Mathew, Jerom in his prologe of mathew seiþ þus here bigynnyþ furst chapitill of Mathew (fols. 1r–1v); Here eendiþ þe gospels of mathew prolog, Here bygynnyn þe gospels of marke (fols. 46v–47r). Blank spaces left for rubrics at the beginnings of prologues and gospels of Luke and John, and all epistles apart from Romans. At the end of John: Here eendiþ þe gospel of ioon. & also here is þe eendynge of alle þe gospellis as þei stonden in þe bible by þe seiynge of þe foure ewangelistis mathew Marke luke & Ioon. Here bygynnyþ þe prolog to fore þe epistlis to romayns & bygynneþ þus (fol. 137v). Includes two prologues to Romans, Firste vndirstonde vs byhoueþ… and Romayns þe whiche in þe cyte of rome…. Running titles in red consisting of abbreviated titles of books without chapter numbers in more than one hand and style. The beginnings of periods are marked with red strokes or paraphs. Chapter numbers as red Roman numerals, usually in the form iiij chapter, capᵐ xiijᵐ or similar. Added material within the text is underlined in red or black. Occasionally corrections in a contemporary hand. Catchword adam on fol. 198; a quire or quires are missing at the end. Fols. 199r–201v are paper flyleaves.

supportDesc.collation: (fols. i–iii) paper flyleaves | (fols. 1–88) I–XI (8) | (fols. 89–94) XII (6) | (fols. 95–198) XIII–XXV (8) | (fols. 199–201) paper flyleaves. Catchwords survive. Quire signatures occasionally survive, including a–b (fols. 111–126), r–t (fols. 127–150), d–h (fols. 151–190); breaks in the sequence of signatures do not correspond to any textual boundaries. salmon… (fol. 2r)

layoutDesc.layout: ruled for two columns, with single vertical and horizontal bounding lines extending the full height and width of page; an additional set of double bounding lines in the lower and outer margins; 29 lines per page on fols. 1–34r; 36–38 per page on fols. 34v–198v; and 38 lines per page in New Testament; written space: c. 125–30 80

handDesc.handNote: textura; the work of several scribes; variable size of script

decoDesc.decoNote: 2- to 4-line plain red initials at the beginnings of books and prologues, some not filled in; 2-line plain red initials at the beginnings of chapters. Border, made of a zig-zag pattern drawn in red ink, in the margin of Luke 12 (fol. 92r).

binding.p:
Brown leather over pasteboard, blind fillet-line border round the outer edge of both covers. Four raised bands on spine. Gold lettering on spine: ‘Newe
Testament’ and ‘MS.’. Marbled paper pastedowns and flyleaves.

origin.p:
Dialect survey:
ony(3)/any(5)/eny(2), eche(3)/ech(6)/ich(1), fyer(5)/fiyr(2)/fyr(1)/fuyr(2), ȝeuen(2)/ȝouen(8), lyf(6)/liyf(4), liyk(1)/lyke(7)/lyche(2), muche(7)/myche(2)/ miche(1), siȝe(1)/sauȝ(4) (sg.), sawen(3)/seyen(2) (pl.), selue(1)/self(9), suche(10), þouȝ(1), þoruȝ(2)/þoru(4)/þorou(1)
-iþ(8)/-eþ(2) (pres.ind.3sg.), -en(10) (pres.ind.pl.), -ynge(10) (pres.part.), sche(10) (3sg.fem.pronoun, nom.), þei(10) (3pl.pronoun, nom.), hem(10) (3pl.pronoun, oblique), her(10) (3pl.pronoun, possessive)

history.acquisition: Queen’s College, Oxford; bookplate on the upper pastedown.

recordHist.source: Elizabeth Solopova, Manuscripts of the Wycliffite Bible in the Bodleian and Oxford College Libraries, Exeter Medieval Texts and Studies (Liverpool: Liverpool University Press, 2016), no. 60.

listBibl.bibl: Forshall, J. and Madden, F. (eds), The Holy Bible … in the earliest English versions made from the Latin Vulgate by John Wycliffe and his followers, 4 vols (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1850), vol. 1, p. liii.
Coxe, H. O., Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque Oxoniensibus hodie adservantur, 2 vols (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1852), vol. 1, Codices MSS. Collegii Reginensis, pp. 86–7.
Ogilvie-Thomson, S. J., Index of Middle English prose, 18 vols (Cambridge, 1984– ), Handlist VIII (1991), p. 83. de Hamel, C., The book: a history of the Bible (London: Phaidon, 2001), pp. 184–6.
Dove, M., The first English Bible: the text and context of the Wycliffite versions (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2007), pp. 142, 302.
